db:abstract.db:para: The Hello GL example demonstrates the basic use of the OpenGL-related classes provided with Qt.

db:article.db:programlisting:
VPATH += ../shared INCLUDEPATH += ../shared
HEADERS = glwidget.h \ window.h \ qtlogo.h SOURCES = glwidget.cpp \ main.cpp \ window.cpp \ qtlogo.cpp QT += opengl widgets
# install target.path = $$[QT_INSTALL_EXAMPLES]/opengl/hellogl INSTALLS += target
simulator: warning(This example might not fully work on Simulator platform)
contains(QT_CONFIG, opengles.) { contains(QT_CONFIG, angle): \ warning("Qt was built with ANGLE, which provides only OpenGL ES 2.0 on top of DirectX 9.0c") error("This example requires Qt to be configured with -opengl desktop") }
